identificationModule.officialTitle: Patent Foramen Ovale Closure With the AMPLATZER PFO OCCLUDER in Patients With Recurrent Cryptogenic Stroke Due to Presumed Paradoxical Embolism Through a Patent Foramen Ovale Who Have Failed Conventional Drug Therapy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Closure of Patent Foramen Ovale with the AMPLATZERÂ® PFO OCCLUDER in patients with at least two cryptogenic strokes due to presumed paradoxical embolism through a patent foramen ovale and who have failed conventional therapy.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The primary objective of the PFO Access Registry is to allow access to the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder in subjects with a PFO who have already experienced at least two cryptogenic strokes due to presumed paradoxical embolism through a patent foramen ovale and who have failed conventional drug therapy.

interventions.name: Device closure with the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder
interventions.description: Device closure with the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Patent foramen ovale (PFO); recurrent cryptogenic stroke; failed antiplatelet/anticoagulant therapy

Exclusion Criteria:

International normalized ration (INR) outside of 2-3; intracardiac thrombus (subjects may be enrolled after resolution of thrombus)

browseBranches.name: Diseases and Abnormalities at or Before Birth
